meanings.definition: Oldest in age or seniority within a family.
meanings.sent1: My eldest sister is taller than me.
meanings.sent2: She is the eldest sibling in our family.
meanings.sent3: The eldest cat in the house always steals my seat.
meanings.sent4: Her eldest wisdom guides us through tough times.
meanings.sent5: The eldest tree in the forest stood tall and proud.

meanings.definition: The firstborn child in a family.
meanings.sent1: The eldest always gets to choose the movie we watch.
meanings.sent2: Being the eldest comes with more responsibilities.
meanings.sent3: The eldest's toys are scattered all over the room.
meanings.sent4: She is the eldest, but also the most caring.
meanings.sent5: The eldest's laughter fills the house with joy.

meanings.definition: Of the highest age or seniority in a group.
meanings.sent1: The eldest member of the team has the most experience.
meanings.sent2: He is the eldest player on the field.
meanings.sent3: The eldest student in the class always helps others.
meanings.sent4: Her eldest cat is the boss of all other pets.
meanings.sent5: The eldest building in town holds many stories within its walls.
